Node.Text: What a nice evening! To the fourth floor, if you would.
Oh, what a shame! I just remembered that I ran out of my orange blossom perfume today. I'll have to buy more this week.
Orange blossom?
Yes, dear. I was wearing it when I first met my husband.
What happened to him?
Not to be rude, dear, but I'd rather not say... it's very personal.
He used to work in the mines downtown. Being exposed to the coal dust ruined his lungs, but he wouldn't quit the job, no matter how hard I tried to convince him. Then, the cancer took him.
I'm so sorry for your loss, Caroline.
It's alright, dear, it's all in the past. But thank you.
How long were you both married?
I cherished his company for 45 years, and I don't regret a single moment of it. It is difficult without him sometimes, but I do my best to carry on.
What are your thoughts on Alex?
Alex? She's that reporter girl, isn't she? Well, we don't talk much, but she always seems to have that tape recorder with her. I wonder what she's picked up on it?
What do you think of Charles?
Oh, the groundskeeper. He's very gentile, and always productive. I can't say I'm close to him, but you must respect a man like that.
I don't believe I've asked your name yet, operator.
My name is Steve.
Well, it's nice to formally meet you, Steve. Have a good night, now!
With all due respect, I'd like to keep that information to myself.
Oh, I see. Have a good night, then.
